;Two factors explain the splurge. The first relates to taxes. Across the rich world, receipts are surprisingly weak. In America, revenue from income taxes deducted from pay fell slightly last year. ;Taxmen are suffering because of market ructions in late 2022 and early 2023. Tech firms, which pay big salaries, let staff go, trimming income-tax takes. ;How long can the firehose keep blasting? At first glance, it looks like it could keep going for a while. Markets have gone on a tear, which will boost tax receipts. ;American exceptionalism

;

;Now that is changing, however. The interest rates facing governments are not yet falling, even as economic growth and inflation come down. This is already making the fiscal arithmetic more daunting.
